sentence.Network_en: Their own lives already seemed to possess the symmetries of narrative art.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (as an adjective): from French narratif, -ive, from late Latin narrativus 'telling a story', from the verb narrare (see narrate)

entry.def: A narrative is a story or an account of a series of events.

example.ex: Sloan began his narrative with the day of the murder.
example.tran: 斯隆以发生谋杀案的那天作为故事的开端。

entry.tran: (通常指小说中一系列事件的)记叙，叙述，讲述
entry.def: Narrative is the description of a series of events, usually in a novel.

example.ex: Neither author was very strong on narrative.
example.tran: 两个作者都不是很善于讲故事。

means.word_mean: 1. a message that tells the particulars of an act or occurrence or course of events; presented in writing or drama or cinema or as a radio or television program;

sentences.sentence: "Disney's stories entertain adults as well as children"

means.word_mean: 1. consisting of or characterized by the telling of a story;

means.word_mean: 叙述, 讲述; 叙述部分

sentences.en: In narrative, the reporting verb is in the past tense.
sentences.cn: 在叙述过程中, 间接引语的动词通常用过去式。

sentences.en: Narrative makes up most of the book.
sentences.cn: 这本书的大部分篇幅都是叙述性的。

sentences.en: He was a writer of great narrative power.
sentences.cn: 他是一位颇有记述能力的作家。
